channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl Programmer Opportunity - Join a Prominent Tech Publishing Powerhouse in the Philippines
item.description: Our UK-based client is a global leader in the enterprise technology publishing industry, providing audiences worldwide with stimulating perspectives and unique news on enterprise tech that matters today and tomorrow. They are currently seeking a passionate and exceptional Perl programmer based in the Philippines to join their team.

item.title: Adventure Awaits! Senior Perl roles in Malaysia, Dubai and Malta
item.description: Clever folks know that if you’re lucky, you can earn a living and have an adventure at the same time. Enter our international client: online trading is their game, and they’re looking for Perl people with passion, drive, and an appreciation for new experiences.

item.title: Perl Programmer with Rust Experience - UK Remote
item.description: Are you a talented Perl programmer with Rust experience looking to work for a cutting-edge enterprise tech publisher that’s at the forefront of the industry? Look no further than our client, a renowned publisher that provides unique news and stimulating perspectives on the enterprise tech that powers businesses across the globe.

item.title: Perl and Koha
item.description: August 14-18, 2023, Helsinki, Finland

item.title: The Perl and Raku Conference 2023
item.description: July 11-13, 2023, Toronto, Canada

item.title: The risk of using Open Source libraries - do you have the source code?
item.description: This is part of a series discussing the risks and costs of using Open Source 3rd party libraries. That is, CPAN modules in Perl.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report.

item.title: PWC 218
item.description: Nice and easy breakdown makes the task so simple. I am sure you will find it easy to follow too.

item.title: The one about maximums
item.description: Simon nailed it and got the job done with precision. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Maximum Matrix
item.description: Raku and Rust are the favourite this week. If you are Raku/Rust fan then you must checkout.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #218
item.description: Short and sweet, to the point and move on. Well done.

item.title: Multiply three and binary matrix
item.description: Dedicated member like Peter never stops contributing even when on break. Thank you for everything.

item.title: Highscore!
item.description: A thorough and detailed analysis makes the blog post my favourite. Highly recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 218
item.description: Use of CPAN and smart one-liner makes it elegant. Yet another impressive solution.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 218
item.description: Just in time, but worth waiting. You really don't want to miss it.

item.title: PWC218 - Matrix Score
item.description: No questions asked, wow, that is an achievement. Bonus we have a detailed discussion of the solution. Cool attempt.

item.title: PWC218 - Maximum Product
item.description: Nice and easy solution with self explanatory notes. Well done.

item.title: Feeling Negative
item.description: Story telling style blogging is my favourite. It's worth checking. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Scored Product
item.description: Time for some more one-liner in Raku. Keep it up great work.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 218
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Maximum Product" and "Matrix Score" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 219
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks: "Sorted Squares" and "Travel Expenditure". If you are new to the weekly challenge, why not join us and have fun every week? For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Data::Resolver refactoring
item.description: Trying new OOP interface. Is it worth it?

item.title: Coding discipline: resist premature generalization
item.description: factor or re-factor? Find the answer in the post.

item.title: Data::Resolver tricky test
item.description: If you are into testing then this is for you. Interesting use case.

item.title: Relying on CPAN modules
item.description: Interesting topic to be discussed, specially if you are CPAN fan. Please do checkout.

item.title: This week in PSC (108)
item.description: Are you waiting for Perl v5.38? Good news, no blocker and ready for RC1. Hurray!!!

item.title: #618 - Conference Season?
item.description:
Hi there,

It seems we have been spoiled with the in-person conference. For all the Perl fans, we got two choices, The Perl and Raku Conference in Toronto and The Perl and Koha Conference in Helsinki. I would highly recommend the one convenient to you. We all need to come together and share the knowledge.

I am all set for the one in Toronto. Thanks to the organisers, I got the time slot to give a talk on The Weekly Challenge. Looking at the list of attendees and speakers, it is going to be fun 3 days event. Looking forward to meet fellow Team PWC members at the event.

Few weeks ago, I spoke about the ambitious project, The Perl Conference in India. Soon I realised, it isn't the right time to talk about. Although not my idea originally, I am taking a back seat for now. I hope to see it happening in my life time.

Enjoy the rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
